This subtle [corruption](bad-linguistics) was noticed by ancient grammarians and may have even been the namegiver of a later misinterpreted 'Ã¯' iota Î¹ÏÏ„Î± â‰ˆ â²“â²ŸÏ¯ eiÅt.  
While today iota often refers to the tiny yodh ×™ dot on top of the Î¹, turning 'Î¹' into 'i', originally it may have  
distinguished aita from VÃ¤ter.
